## Public Member Functions

### callWrapperAsync() {#af21de81dd1759e3d1385c8ed7c0aa472}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::SimpleRemoteEPC::callWrapperAsync (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> WrapperFnAddr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executorprocesscontrol/incomingwfrhandler">IncomingWFRHandler</a> OnComplete, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; char &gt; ArgBuffer)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Run a wrapper function in the executor.

The given WFRHandler will be called on the result when it is returned.

The wrapper function should be callable as:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">CWrapperFunctionResult fn(uint8&#95;t &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a>, uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
&#123;.cpp&#125;

### disconnect() {#ab4c26bc089f703fd592ca80cdeb9bd3f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="Error llvm::orc::SimpleRemoteEPC::disconnect ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Disconnect from the target process.

This should be called after the JIT session is shut down.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-h/#l00084">84</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-h">SimpleRemoteEPC.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-cpp/#l00126">126</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-cpp">SimpleRemoteEPC.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### handleDisconnect() {#a1cbd9c46f77bca6e36af9be20d9ed738}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::SimpleRemoteEPC::handleDisconnect (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> Err)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Handle a disconnection from the underlying transport.

No further messages should be sent to handleMessage after this is called. Err may contain an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> value indicating unexpected disconnection. This allows clients to log such errors, but no attempt should be made at recovery (which should be handled inside the transport class, if it is supported at all).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-h/#l00090">90</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-h">SimpleRemoteEPC.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-cpp/#l00191">191</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/simpleremoteepc-cpp">SimpleRemoteEPC.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### handleMessage() {#a4f573eb08d6775d4348ae9efd7532f7a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; SimpleRemoteEPCTransportClient::HandleMessageAction &gt; llvm::orc::SimpleRemoteEPC::handleMessage (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a1448b52253eb43f8f07b7f5d94336a47">SimpleRemoteEPCOpcode</a> OpC, uint64&#95;t SeqNo, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> TagAddr, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a7b57ebab4d32c81530df07ac39a3b0ca">SimpleRemoteEPCArgBytesVector</a> ArgBytes)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Handle receipt of a message.

Returns an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> if the message cannot be handled, &#39;EndSession&#39; if the client will not accept any further messages, and &#39;ContinueSession&#39; otherwise.

### lookupSymbolsAsync() {#a11e56da51ed067ea889375b88daecbda}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::SimpleRemoteEPC::lookupSymbolsAsync (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/orc/dylibmanager/lookuprequest">LookupRequest</a> &gt; Request, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/dylibmanager/#ae71ec09d3b629cd60c40a90681bf09d3">SymbolLookupCompleteFn</a> F)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Search for symbols in the target process.

The result of the lookup is a 2-dimensional array of target addresses that correspond to the lookup order. If a required symbol is not found then this method will return an error. If a weakly referenced symbol is not found then it be assigned a &#39;0&#39; value.
